name: 2-[(E)-2-(4-Hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol
Reason: 2-[(E)-2-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)vinyl]-6-methoxy-4-methylphenol has a melting point that can be predicted by analyzing its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 2-methyl-6-methoxyphenol, which has a melting point of -10.5 °C. The introduction of a vinyl group (C=C) adds approximately +20 °C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The hydroxyl group (OH) and methoxy group (OCH3) each add +5 °C due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential. The 4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl group (C1=C(C=C1)C(=O)O) adds +20 °C due to increased molecular weight and pi-pi interactions. The overall effect of these structural components is estimated to be +50 °C.
